Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior glazed black (only traces remaining); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of belly and hind leg of feline standing to right (glaze almost entirely worn); dot as filling ornament; below, three bands and tips of three rays.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1159 and 1924,1201.1168.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.076) (Phase 1)
